 47	 async {
 48	 semaphore.withPermit {
 49	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)

 51	 }

 53	
 54	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 55	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 56	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 57	 events.addAll(pageEvents)

 70	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 71	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>): Int {
 72	 var left = 1
 73	 var right = 10 // Starting point for binary search
 74	 var lastValidPage = 1
 75	
 76	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 77	 while (true) {
 78	 try {
 79	 println("Checking page $right for upper bound...")
 80	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 81	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 82	
 83	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 84	 lastValidPage = right
 85	 left = right
 86	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 87	 } else {
 88	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 89	 break
 90	 }
 91	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 92	 println("Error checking page $right: ${e.message}")
 93	 break
 94	 }
 95	 }
 96	
 97	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 98	 while (left <= right) {
 99	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 100	
 101	 try {
 102	 println("Binary search: checking page $mid (range: $left-$right)")
 103	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 104	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 105	 } else {
 106	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 107	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 108	 content
 109	 }
 110	
 111	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 112	 lastValidPage = mid
 113	 left = mid + 1
 114	 } else {
 115	 right = mid - 1
 116	 }
 117	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 118	 println("Error during binary search at page $mid: ${e.message}")
 119	 right = mid - 1
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 return lastValidPage
 124	}
 125	
 126	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 127	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 128	 client: HttpClient,
 129	 pageIndex: Int,
 130	 cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 131	): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 132	 return try {
 133	 println("Processing page $pageIndex...")
 134	
 135	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 136	 // Use cached response from binary search
 137	 println("Using cached response for page $pageIndex")
 138	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 139	 } else {
 140	 // Fetch page if not cached
 141	 println("Fetching page $pageIndex...")
 142	 scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 143	 }
 144	
 145	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 146	 println("Found ${pageEvents.size} events on page $pageIndex")
 147	 pageEvents
 148	
 149	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 150	 println("Error processing page $pageIndex: ${e.message}")
 151	 null
 152	 }
 153	}
 154	
 155	// Helper function to fetch page content
 156	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 157	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 158	 return response.bodyAsText()
 159	}
 160	
 161	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 162	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 163	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 164	
 165	 // Check for end of events message
 166	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 167	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 168	 return false
 169	 }
 170	
 171	 // Check if page has event containers
 172	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 173	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 174	}
 175	
 176	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 177	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 178	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 179	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 180	
 181	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 182	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 183	
 184	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 185	 try {
 186	 val titleElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 187	 val linkElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 188	 val dateElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 189	
 190	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 191	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 192	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 193	
 194	 val event = mapOf(
 195	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 196	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 197	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 198	 )
 199	 events.add(event)
 200	 }

I've successfully implemented the concurrent version of the web scraper. Here's a summary of the changes:

## Concurrent Web Scraper with Binary Search + Response Caching

### Key Features:

1. **Sequential Binary Search**: First performs binary search to find the last page with events and caches responses
2. **Concurrent Page Processing**: After binary search, processes all pages concurrently using cached responses when available
3. **Semaphore Rate Limiting**: Limits concurrent requests to 5 to avoid overwhelming the server
4. **Response Reuse**: Maximizes efficiency by reusing cached responses from binary search

### How it works:

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/DreamParkWebScraper.kt mode=EXCERPT
// Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
val semaphore = Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server

val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 async {
 semaphore.withPermit {
 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 }
 }
}.awaitAll()
````

### Concurrent Processing Function:

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/DreamParkWebScraper.kt mode=EXCERPT
val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 // Use cached response from binary search
 println("Using cached response for page $pageIndex")
 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
} else {
 // Fetch page if not cached
 println("Fetching page $pageIndex...")
 scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
}
````

### Performance Benefits:

1. **Binary Search Efficiency**: Quickly finds the last page with events starting at page 10
2. **Response Caching**: Stores responses during binary search for later reuse
3. **Concurrent Processing**: Processes all pages simultaneously after binary search completes
4. **Rate Limiting**: Semaphore prevents overwhelming the server with too many concurrent requests
5. **Optimal Network Usage**: Reuses cached responses when possible, only fetches uncached pages

### Execution Flow:

1. **Phase 1 (Sequential)**: Binary search to find last page, caching responses
2. **Phase 2 (Concurrent)**: Process all pages 1-N simultaneously, using cache when available
3. **Result**: All events extracted with title, link, and dateOnly values

This approach combines the best of both worlds: efficient discovery through binary search with maximum performance through concurrent processing and intelligent caching!

There are several ways to determine the optimal semaphore limit to avoid overwhelming the server:

## Methods to Determine Optimal Semaphore Limit:

### 1. **Server Response Analysis**
Monitor for these warning signs that indicate you're hitting limits:
- HTTP 429 (Too Many Requests) errors
- HTTP 503 (Service Unavailable) errors
- Timeouts increasing significantly
- Connection refused errors

### 2. **Performance Testing Approach**
You could add adaptive logic to find the sweet spot:

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/DreamParkWebScraper.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
// Start conservative and monitor performance
val semaphore = Semaphore(3) // Start with 3, could be adaptive

// Monitor timing to detect if we're overwhelming the server
val startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 async {
 semaphore.withPermit {
 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 val result = processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 val requestTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 if (requestTime > 10000) { // If requests take >10s, we might be overwhelming
 println("Slow request detected for page $pageIndex: ${requestTime}ms")
 }
 result
 }
 }
}.awaitAll()
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### 3. **Conservative Guidelines**
For most websites:
- **Start with 2-3** concurrent requests
- **Small sites**: 1-2 concurrent requests
- **Medium sites**: 3-5 concurrent requests 
- **Large sites (like major e-commerce)**: 5-10 concurrent requests

### 4. **Adaptive Semaphore**
You could implement logic that adjusts based on response times:

```kotlin
private fun calculateOptimalConcurrency(responseTime: Long): Int {
 return when {
 responseTime < 1000 -> 8 // Fast responses, can handle more
 responseTime < 3000 -> 5 // Medium responses
 responseTime < 5000 -> 3 // Slow responses
 else -> 1 // Very slow, be conservative
 }
}
```

### 5. **Website-Specific Considerations**
For `dreamparknj.com` specifically:
- It's a smaller venue website (not a major platform)
- **Current limit of 5 is probably reasonable**
- Could even be conservative with 3-4
- Monitor the console output for any timeout errors

### 6. **Respectful Scraping Practices**
- Check if the site has a `robots.txt` file
- Look for rate limiting headers in responses
- Consider adding small delays between requests if needed
- Be prepared to back off if you see errors

**Recommendation**: Start with 3-4 concurrent requests for this site and monitor the console output. If you see consistent fast responses without errors, you could cautiously increase to 5-6. If you see timeouts or slow responses, reduce to 2-3.

Would you like me to add some monitoring logic to help detect if the current semaphore limit is appropriate?

 12	// Optimized web scraper using binary search to find last page, then reusing cached responses
 13	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(): MutableList<Map<String, String>> {
 14	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 15	
 16	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 17	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 18	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 19	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 20	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 21	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 25	 engine {
 26	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 27	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 28	 }
 29	 }
 30	
 31	 try {
 32	 // Step 1: Use binary search to find the last page with events and cache responses
 33	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 34	 val lastPageWithEvents = findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 35	
 36	 println("Found last page with events: $lastPageWithEvents")
 37	 println("Cached ${cachedResponses.size} responses during binary search")
 38	
 39	 // Step 2: Go through each page from 1 to lastPageWithEvents and scrape events
 40	 for (pageIndex in 1..lastPageWithEvents) {
 41	 println("Processing page $pageIndex...")
 42	
 43	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 44	 // Use cached response from binary search
 45	 println("Using cached response for page $pageIndex")
 46	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 47	 } else {
 48	 // Fetch page if not cached
 49	 println("Fetching page $pageIndex...")
 50	 scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 54	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 55	 println("Found ${pageEvents.size} events on page $pageIndex")
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 } finally {
 59	 client.close()
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 return events
 63	}

 65	// Safely scrape a single page with error handling
 66	private suspend fun scrapePageSafely(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 67	 return try {
 68	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 69	 val htmlContent = response.bodyAsText()
 70	 parsePage(htmlContent)
 71	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 72	 // Log error but don't crash the entire scraping process
 73	 println("Error scraping page $pageIndex: ${e.message}")
 74	 null
 75	 }
 76	}

 78	// Optimized page parsing with single DOM traversal
 79	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 80	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 81	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 82	
 83	 // Check for end of events message
 84	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 85	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 86	 return emptyList()
 87	 }
 88	
 89	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 90	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 91	
 92	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 93	 try {
 94	 val titleElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 95	 val linkElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 96	 val dateElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 97	
 98	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 99	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 100	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 101	
 102	 val event = mapOf(
 103	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 104	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 105	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 106	 )
 107	 events.add(event)
 108	 }
 109	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 110	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 111	 println("Error parsing event: ${e.message}")
 112	 }
 113	 }

Now I've added comprehensive performance monitoring to both the web scraper and the UI refresh logic. Here's what I've implemented to help identify bottlenecks:

## Performance Monitoring Added

### **Web Scraper Monitoring:**
1. **Total scraping time** with percentage breakdown
2. **Binary search timing** (both phases: upper bound finding + binary search)
3. **Individual request timing** for each HTTP call
4. **Concurrent processing timing** 
5. **Page parsing timing** for each page
6. **Cache hit/miss tracking**

### **UI Layer Monitoring:**
1. **Total refresh time** from button click to completion
2. **Web scraping vs caching time** breakdown
3. **JSON serialization timing** (potential bottleneck)
4. **DataStore operations timing**

## How to Use This for Bottleneck Detection:

**Run the app and trigger a refresh**, then check the console output. You'll see detailed timing like:

```
 Starting web scraping process...
 HTTP client created in 15ms
 Binary search completed in 2340ms
 Concurrent processing completed in 1200ms
 TOTAL SCRAPING TIME: 3600ms (3.6s)
 Performance breakdown:
 - Binary search: 2340ms (65%)
 - Concurrent processing: 1200ms (33%)
```

## Common Bottlenecks to Look For:

1. **Network Requests**: If individual page fetches take >3-5 seconds
2. **Binary Search**: If this takes >50% of total time, the site might be slow
3. **JSON Serialization**: If this takes >500ms, consider alternative serialization
4. **Concurrent Processing**: If this is slow despite caching, parsing might be the issue
5. **DataStore Operations**: If caching takes >1 second, storage might be slow

## Next Steps:

1. **Trigger a refresh** and check the Android Studio Logcat for the detailed timing output
2. **Identify which phase** is taking the most time
3. **Share the console output** with me so I can help optimize the specific bottleneck

The monitoring will show exactly where the time is being spent, whether it's:
- Network requests (most likely)
- HTML parsing 
- JSON serialization
- Data storage
- Or something else entirely

Try running a refresh now and let me know what the timing output shows!

The performance monitoring reveals exactly where the bottleneck is. Here's the analysis:

## **Bottleneck Identified: Network Requests**

### **Key Findings:**

1. **Total Time: 8.6 seconds** - which is indeed slow for a refresh
2. **Network requests are the primary bottleneck** - individual page fetches taking 500ms-1400ms each
3. **Binary search takes 67% of total time** (5.6s) due to slow network requests
4. **JSON serialization is fast** (219ms) - not a bottleneck
5. **HTML parsing is very fast** (23-74ms per page) - not a bottleneck

### **Specific Issues:**

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/DreamParkWebScraper.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```
 Page 10 fetched in 1396ms Very slow
 Page 20 fetched in 891ms Slow
 Page 15 fetched in 916ms Slow
 Page 12 fetched in 1079ms Slow
```
</augment_code_snippet>

**Each network request is taking 0.5-1.4 seconds**, which is the root cause of the slow refresh.

## **Optimization Strategies:**

### **1. Reduce Binary Search Network Calls**
The binary search is making 5 network requests sequentially. We could optimize this by:

**Option A: Start with a smaller initial range**
```kotlin
var right = 5 // Instead of 10, start smaller
```

**Option B: Use a more aggressive doubling strategy**
```kotlin
// Skip some pages during upper bound finding
right = if (right < 5) right * 3 else right * 2
```

### **2. Optimize HTTP Client Settings**
The network requests themselves are slow. Let's try:

```kotlin
// More aggressive timeouts and connection settings
install(HttpTimeout) {
 requestTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 30s
 connectTimeoutMillis = 8.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 15s
 socketTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 30s
}

engine {
 connectTimeout = 8_000 // Reduced from 15s
 socketTimeout = 15_000 // Reduced from 30s
 // Add connection pooling
 threadsCount = 4
 pipelining = true
}
```

### **3. Cache More Aggressively**
Since the site content doesn't change frequently, we could:
- Cache responses for longer periods
- Use HTTP caching headers if the site supports them

## **Quick Fix Recommendation:**

Let me implement the most impactful optimization - **reducing the binary search overhead** by starting with a smaller range and using better HTTP settings:

Would you like me to:

1. **Optimize the HTTP client settings** for faster requests?
2. **Reduce the binary search range** to minimize network calls?
3. **Add HTTP caching** to reuse responses longer?
4. **All of the above**?

The biggest impact will come from options 1 & 2, which should reduce your refresh time from 8.6s to around 4-5s.

Which optimization would you like me to implement first?

The performance monitoring reveals exactly where the bottleneck is. Here's the analysis:

## **Bottleneck Identified: Network Requests**

### **Key Findings:**

1. **Total Time: 8.6 seconds** - which is indeed slow for a refresh
2. **Network requests are the primary bottleneck** - individual page fetches taking 500ms-1400ms each
3. **Binary search takes 67% of total time** (5.6s) due to slow network requests
4. **JSON serialization is fast** (219ms) - not a bottleneck
5. **HTML parsing is very fast** (23-74ms per page) - not a bottleneck

### **Specific Issues:**

```` path=app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/DreamParkWebScraper.kt mode=EXCERPT
 Page 10 fetched in 1396ms Very slow
 Page 20 fetched in 891ms Slow
 Page 15 fetched in 916ms Slow
 Page 12 fetched in 1079ms Slow
````

**Each network request is taking 0.5-1.4 seconds**, which is the root cause of the slow refresh.

## **Optimization Strategies:**

### **1. Reduce Binary Search Network Calls**
The binary search is making 5 network requests sequentially. We could optimize this by:

**Option A: Start with a smaller initial range**
```kotlin
var right = 5 // Instead of 10, start smaller
```

**Option B: Use a more aggressive doubling strategy**
```kotlin
// Skip some pages during upper bound finding
right = if (right < 5) right * 3 else right * 2
```

### **2. Optimize HTTP Client Settings**
The network requests themselves are slow. Let's try:

```kotlin
// More aggressive timeouts and connection settings
install(HttpTimeout) {
 requestTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 30s
 connectTimeoutMillis = 8.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 15s
 socketTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds // Reduced from 30s
}

engine {
 connectTimeout = 8_000 // Reduced from 15s
 socketTimeout = 15_000 // Reduced from 30s
 // Add connection pooling
 threadsCount = 4
 pipelining = true
}
```

### **3. Cache More Aggressively**
Since the site content doesn't change frequently, we could:
- Cache responses for longer periods
- Use HTTP caching headers if the site supports them

## **Quick Fix Recommendation:**

Let me implement the most impactful optimization - **reducing the binary search overhead** by starting with a smaller range and using better HTTP settings:

Would you like me to:

1. **Optimize the HTTP client settings** for faster requests?
2. **Reduce the binary search range** to minimize network calls?
3. **Add HTTP caching** to reuse responses longer?
4. **All of the above**?

The biggest impact will come from options 1 & 2, which should reduce your refresh time from 8.6s to around 4-5s.

Which optimization would you like me to implement first?

","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"b60973a6-5a2c-41dd-bd5f-29db103700f1","request_message":"","structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Excellent! Let me create a summary of the optimizations I've implemented:

## **Performance Optimizations Implemented**

### **1. DataStore Caching for Last Page Count**
- **Saves the last discovered page count** to avoid binary search on subsequent refreshes
- **Quick verification** (2 requests max) instead of full binary search (5+ requests)
- **Intelligent fallback** to full search if cached value is invalid

### **2. HTTP Client Threading Optimization**
```kotlin
engine {
 connectTimeout = 15_000
 socketTimeout = 30_000
 threadsCount = 4 // Better concurrent performance
}
```

### **3. Smart Binary Search**
- **Starts from cached page** when available
- **Skips upper bound finding** when responses are already cached
- **Limited search range** when starting from cached value

## **Expected Performance Improvements**

### **First Run (No Cache):**
- Same as before: ~8.6 seconds (needs to discover page count)

### **Subsequent Runs (With Cache):**
- **Cache hit scenario**: ~2-3 seconds (just verification + concurrent processing)
- **Cache miss scenario**: ~4-5 seconds (limited binary search + concurrent processing)

### **Performance Breakdown (Cached):**
```
 Cache verification: ~1-2 seconds (2 requests)
 Concurrent processing: ~2-3 seconds (9 pages)
 JSON + DataStore: ~0.3 seconds
Total: ~3-5 seconds (vs 8.6 seconds before)
```

## **Testing the Optimization**

1. **First refresh**: Will take the usual ~8.6 seconds (establishing cache)
2. **Second refresh**: Should be significantly faster (~3-5 seconds)
3. **Monitor the logs** for cache hit/miss messages

The key improvement is that after the first run, the scraper will:
- Use cached page count (11 pages)
- Verify with just 2 quick requests
- Skip the expensive binary search phase
- Go straight to concurrent processing

**Try running two refreshes in a row** and compare the timing! The second one should be much faster.

This is exactly how the optimization is designed to work - the first run establishes the cache, and subsequent runs benefit from it!

The optimization is working perfectly! 

## **Performance Improvement Results:**

### **Before vs After:**
- **First refresh**: 8.889s **Second refresh**: 4.959s
- **Improvement**: **44% faster** (3.9 seconds saved!)

### **Binary Search Optimization:**
- **Before**: 5.844s (67% of total time)
- **After**: 2.070s (42% of total time) 
- **Binary search improvement**: **65% faster** (3.8 seconds saved!)

### **What Changed:**
```
 Cache verification completed in 2067ms
```
Instead of doing a full binary search (5+ requests), it now:
1. **Uses cached page count** (11)
2. **Quick verification** with just 2 requests
3. **Skips expensive upper bound finding**

## **Current Bottleneck Analysis:**

Now that we've optimized the binary search, the **network requests during concurrent processing** are the remaining bottleneck:

- **Concurrent processing**: 2.776s (57% of total time)
- **Individual requests**: Still taking 900ms-1400ms each

## **Further Optimization Options:**

Since network latency is the core issue (each request takes ~1 second), we could:

1. **Reduce semaphore limit** from 5 to 3-4 to avoid overwhelming the server
2. **Add request retry logic** with exponential backoff
3. **Implement connection keep-alive optimizations**

But honestly, **4.9 seconds for 103 events across 11 pages is quite reasonable** for web scraping, especially considering:
- Each page requires a full HTTP request
- HTML parsing is very fast (28-73ms per page)
- The site's response time is the limiting factor

## **Success Summary:**

Your optimization suggestions worked perfectly:
- **DataStore caching**: Reduced binary search from 5.8s to 2.1s
- **Real performance improvement**: 44% faster overall
- **No aggressive caching**: Maintains good UX with fresh data

The refresh time went from **8.9 seconds to 5.0 seconds** - that's a significant improvement that users will definitely notice!

x_01EdKbhpB1y4xmM9GJe7WBet","phase":5,"result":{"text":"Here's  1	package com.example.jetpackcomposefirstproject
 2	
 3	import io.ktor.client.*
 4	import io.ktor.client.engine.android.*
 5	import io.ktor.client.plugins.*
 6	import io.ktor.client.request.*
 7	import io.ktor.client.statement.*
 8	import kotlinx.coroutines.async
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.awaitAll
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.coroutineScope
 11	import kotlinx.coroutines.sync.Semaphore
 12	import kotlinx.coroutines.sync.withPermit
 13	import org.jsoup.Jsoup
 14	import org.jsoup.nodes.Document
 15	import kotlin.time.Duration.Companion.seconds
 16	
 17	// Optimized web scraper with connection reuse, parallel processing, and better error handling
 18	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(): MutableList<Map<String, String>> = coroutineScope {
 19	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 20	
 21	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 22	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 23	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 24	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 25	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 26	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 27	 }
 28	
 29	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 30	 engine {
 31	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 32	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 33	 }
 34	 }
 35	
 36	 try {
 37	 // First, determine how many pages we need to scrape
 38	 val totalPages = determineTotalPages(client)
 39	
 40	 // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 41	 val semaphore = Semaphore(3) // Max 3 concurrent requests
 42	
 43	 // Process pages in parallel batches
 44	 val batchSize = 5
 45	 val allEvents = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 46	
 47	 for (startPage in 1..totalPages step batchSize) {
 48	 val endPage = minOf(startPage + batchSize - 1, totalPages)
 49	
 50	 // Process batch of pages concurrently
 51	 val batchEvents = (startPage..endPage).map { pageIndex ->
 52	 async {
 53	 semaphore.withPermit {
 54	 scrapePageSafely(client, pageIndex)
 55	 }
 56	 }
 57	 }.awaitAll()
 58	
 59	 // Flatten and add all events from this batch
 60	 batchEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 61	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 62	 allEvents.addAll(pageEvents)
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 events.addAll(allEvents)
 68	
 69	 } finally {
 70	 client.close()
 71	 }
 72	
 73	 return@coroutineScope events
 74	}
 75	
 76	// Determine total pages by checking for the "no events" message
 77	private suspend fun determineTotalPages(client: HttpClient): Int {
 78	 var pageIndex = 1
 79	 var maxPages = 10 // Safety limit to prevent infinite loops
 80	
 81	 // Use binary search approach to find the last page more efficiently
 82	 while (pageIndex <= maxPages) {
 83	 try {
 84	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 85	 val htmlContent = response.bodyAsText()
 86	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 87	
 88	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 89	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 90	 return pageIndex - 1 // Previous page was the last valid page
 91	 }
 92	
 93	 // Check if page has events
 94	 val eventTitles = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 95	 if (eventTitles.isEmpty()) {
 96	 return pageIndex - 1
 97	 }
 98	
 99	 pageIndex++
 100	
 101	 // Dynamically increase max pages if we're still finding content
 102	 if (pageIndex > maxPages) {
 103	 maxPages += 10
 104	 }
 105	
 106	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 107	 // If we hit an error, assume previous page was the last
 108	 return maxOf(1, pageIndex - 1)
 109	 }
 110	 }
 111	
 112	 return maxPages
 113	}
 114	
 115	// Safely scrape a single page with error handling
 116	private suspend fun scrapePageSafely(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 117	 return try {
 118	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 119	 val htmlContent = response.bodyAsText()
 120	 parsePage(htmlContent)
 121	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 122	 // Log error but don't crash the entire scraping process
 123	 println("Error scraping page $pageIndex: ${e.message}")
 124	 null
 125	 }
 126	}
 127	
 128	// Optimized page parsing with single DOM traversal
 129	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 130	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 131	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 132	
 133	 // Check for end of events message
 134	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 135	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 136	 return emptyList()
 137	 }
 138	
 139	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 140	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 141	
 142	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 143	 try {
 144	 val titleElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 145	 val linkElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 146	 val dateElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 147	
 148	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 149	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 150	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 151	
 152	 val event = mapOf(
 153	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 154	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 155	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 156	 )
 157	 events.add(event)
 158	 }
 159	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 160	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 161	 println("Error parsing event: ${e.message}")
 162	 }
 163	 }
 164	
 165	 return events
 166	}

 3	import io.ktor.client.*

 9	import org.jsoup.Jsoup

 12	// Optimized web scraper using binary search to find last page, then reusing cached responses
 13	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(): MutableList<Map<String, String>> {
 14	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 15	
 16	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 17	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 18	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 19	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 20	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 21	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 25	 engine {
 26	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 27	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 28	 }
 29	 }
 30	
 31	 try {
 32	 // Step 1: Use binary search to find the last page with events and cache responses
 33	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 34	 val lastPageWithEvents = findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 35	
 36	 println("Found last page with events: $lastPageWithEvents")
 37	 println("Cached ${cachedResponses.size} responses during binary search")
 38	
 39	 // Step 2: Go through each page from 1 to lastPageWithEvents and scrape events
 40	 for (pageIndex in 1..lastPageWithEvents) {
 41	 println("Processing page $pageIndex...")
 42	
 43	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 44	 // Use cached response from binary search
 45	 println("Using cached response for page $pageIndex")
 46	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 47	 } else {
 48	 // Fetch page if not cached
 49	 println("Fetching page $pageIndex...")
 50	 scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 54	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 55	 println("Found ${pageEvents.size} events on page $pageIndex")
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 } finally {
 59	 client.close()
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 return events
 63	}
 64	
 65	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 66	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>): Int {
 67	 var left = 1
 68	 var right = 10 // Starting point for binary search
 69	 var lastValidPage = 1
 70	
 71	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 72	 while (true) {
 73	 try {
 74	 println("Checking page $right for upper bound...")
 75	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 76	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 77	
 78	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 79	 lastValidPage = right
 80	 left = right
 81	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 82	 } else {
 83	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 84	 break
 85	 }
 86	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 87	 println("Error checking page $right: ${e.message}")
 88	 break
 89	 }
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 93	 while (left <= right) {
 94	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 95	
 96	 try {
 97	 println("Binary search: checking page $mid (range: $left-$right)")
 98	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 99	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 100	 } else {
 101	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 102	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 103	 content
 104	 }
 105	
 106	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 107	 lastValidPage = mid
 108	 left = mid + 1
 109	 } else {
 110	 right = mid - 1
 111	 }
 112	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 113	 println("Error during binary search at page $mid: ${e.message}")
 114	 right = mid - 1
 115	 }
 116	 }
 117	
 118	 return lastValidPage
 119	}
 120	
 121	// Helper function to fetch page content
 122	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 123	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 124	 return response.bodyAsText()
 125	}
 126	
 127	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 128	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 129	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 130	
 131	 // Check for end of events message
 132	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 133	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 134	 return false
 135	 }
 136	
 137	 // Check if page has event containers
 138	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 139	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 140	}
 141	
 142	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 143	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 144	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 145	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 146	
 147	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 148	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 149	
 150	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 151	 try {
 152	 val titleElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 153	 val linkElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 154	 val dateElement = eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 155	
 156	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 157	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 158	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 159	
 160	 val event = mapOf(
 161	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 162	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 163	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 164	 )
 165	 events.add(event)
 166	 }
 167	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 168	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 169	 println("Error parsing event: ${e.message}")
 170	 }
 171	 }
 172	
 173	 return events
 174	}

 16	// Optimized web scraper using binary search to find last page, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 17	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(): MutableList<Map<String, String>> = coroutineScope {
 18	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 19	
 20	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 21	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 22	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 23	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 24	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 25	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 26	 }
 27	
 28	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 29	 engine {
 30	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 31	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 32	 }
 33	 }
 34	
 35	 try {
 36	 // Step 1: Use binary search to find the last page with events and cache responses
 37	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 38	 val lastPageWithEvents = findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 39	
 40	 println("Found last page with events: $lastPageWithEvents")
 41	 println("Cached ${cachedResponses.size} responses during binary search")
 42	
 43	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 44	 val semaphore = Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 45	
 46	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 47	 async {
 48	 semaphore.withPermit {
 49	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 50	 }
 51	 }
 52	 }.awaitAll()
 53	
 54	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 55	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 56	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 57	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	
 61	 println("Total events found: ${events.size}")
 62	
 63	 } finally {
 64	 client.close()
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 return@coroutineScope events
 68	}

 69	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 70	 return context.dataStore.data
 71	 .map { preferences ->
 72	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 73	 }
 74	 .firstOrNull()
 75	}

 77	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 78	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 79	 .map { preferences ->
 80	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 81	 }
 82	 .firstOrNull()
 83	
 84	 return jsonString?.let {
 85	 try {
 86	 val parser = Parser.default()
 87	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 88	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 89	
 90	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 91	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 92	 jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 96	 null
 97	 }
 98	 }
 99	}

 111	fun ListViewScreen(navController: NavController, context: MainActivity) {

 118	
 119	 fun forceRefresh() {
 120	 refreshTrigger++
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 124	 isLoading = true
 125	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 126	
 127	 try {

 129	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr

 131	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean

 135	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 136	
 137	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 138	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 139	 needsFreshScrape = true
 140	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 141	 needsFreshScrape = true
 142	 } else {
 143	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 144	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 145	 }
...

 150	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 151	 try {

 153	 scrapeDreamParkEvents()
 154	 }

 156	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 157	
 158	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 159	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 160	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 161	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 162	 }
 163	
 164	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(scrapedEvents)
 165	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 166	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 167	 }
 168	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 169	 }
 170	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 171	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 172	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 173	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 174	 loadedFromCache = true
 175	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 176	 } else {
 177	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 178	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 179	 }
 180	 }
 181	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 182	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 183	 loadedFromCache = true
 184	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 185	 // errorMessage = null
 186	 }
 187	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 188	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 189	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 190	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time
 191	 val fallbackCache = getLastScrapeResult(localContext)
 192	 if (fallbackCache != null) {
 193	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackCache
 194	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 195	 } else {
 196	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 197	 }
 198	 }
 199	 } finally {
 200	 isLoading = false
 201	 }
 202	 }

 16	// Optimized web scraper using binary search to find last page, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 17	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(): MutableList<Map<String, String>> = coroutineScope {
 18	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 19	
 20	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 21	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 22	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 23	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 24	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 25	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 26	 }
 27	
 28	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 29	 engine {
 30	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 31	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 32	 }
 33	 }
 34	
 35	 try {
 36	 // Step 1: Use binary search to find the last page with events and cache responses
 37	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 38	 val lastPageWithEvents = findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 39	
 40	 println("Found last page with events: $lastPageWithEvents")
 41	 println("Cached ${cachedResponses.size} responses during binary search")
 42	
 43	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 44	 val semaphore = Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 45	
 46	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 47	 async {
 48	 semaphore.withPermit {
 49	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 50	 }
 51	 }
 52	 }.awaitAll()
 53	
 54	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 55	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 56	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 57	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	
 61	 println("Total events found: ${events.size}")
 62	
 63	 } finally {
 64	 client.close()
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 return@coroutineScope events
 68	}

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 51	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 78	
 79	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 80	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 81	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 82	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 83	
 84	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 85	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 86	
 87	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 88	 } else {
 89	 cachedLastPage
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 93	
 94	 actualLastPage
 95	 } else {
 96	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 97	
 98	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 99	 }
 100	 } else {
 101	
 102	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 106	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 107	
 108	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 109	
 110	
 111	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 112	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 113	 val semaphore =
 114	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }

 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {

 264	// Helper function to fetch page content
 265	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 266	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 267	 return response.bodyAsText()
 268	}

 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}
 284	
 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...

{\n // Generate a stable key for LazyColumn\n val key: String get() = \"${title}_${date}\"\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Based on my analysis of the code, I can identify several potential performance issues causing the laggy scrolling in the LazyColumn. Let me create a detailed plan to fix these issues:

## Analysis of Performance Issues

I've identified several key performance problems:

1. **Unstable keys in LazyColumn**: The `items(dreamParkEvents)` doesn't provide stable keys, causing unnecessary recompositions
2. **Context parameter in EventCard**: Passing `localContext` to every EventCard creates unstable parameters
3. **Map access in item lambda**: Accessing map values with `dreamParkEvent["title"]` in the items lambda creates unstable state
4. **Missing performance optimizations**: No key specification, no content type specification
5. **Potential recomposition issues**: The EventCard composable could be optimized further

## Detailed Plan

Here's my plan to fix the scrolling performance:

1. **Add stable keys to LazyColumn items** - Use a combination of title and date as unique keys
2. **Optimize EventCard parameters** - Remove context parameter and handle click differently
3. **Pre-extract data outside items lambda** - Create stable data objects instead of accessing maps
4. **Add content type for better performance** - Help LazyColumn optimize item recycling
5. **Optimize EventCard composable** - Add remember blocks and reduce recompositions
6. **Consider data class for events** - Replace Map<String, String> with a proper data class

Let me implement these optimizations:

Let me create a detailed plan to fix these issues:

## Analysis of Performance Issues

I've identified several key performance problems:

1. **Unstable keys in LazyColumn**: The `items(dreamParkEvents)` doesn't provide stable keys, causing unnecessary recompositions
2. **Context parameter in EventCard**: Passing `localContext` to every EventCard creates unstable parameters
3. **Map access in item lambda**: Accessing map values with `dreamParkEvent["title"]` in the items lambda creates unstable state
4. **Missing performance optimizations**: No key specification, no content type specification
5. **Potential recomposition issues**: The EventCard composable could be optimized further

## Detailed Plan

Here's my plan to fix the scrolling performance:

1. **Add stable keys to LazyColumn items** - Use a combination of title and date as unique keys
2. **Optimize EventCard parameters** - Remove context parameter and handle click differently
3. **Pre-extract data outside items lambda** - Create stable data objects instead of accessing maps
4. **Add content type for better performance** - Help LazyColumn optimize item recycling
5. **Optimize EventCard composable** - Add remember blocks and reduce recompositions
6. **Consider data class for events** - Replace Map<String, String> with a proper data class

Let me implement these optimizations:

## Summary of LazyColumn Performance Optimizations

I've successfully implemented several key performance optimizations to fix the laggy scrolling in your LazyColumn:

### **Key Performance Improvements Made:**

1. **Stable Data Structure**
 - Replaced `List<Map<String, String>>` with `List<DreamParkEvent>` data class
 - Added stable key generation using `lazy` delegation for better performance
 - Eliminated map access overhead in the UI layer

2. **LazyColumn Optimizations**
 - **Stable Keys**: Added `key = { event -> event.key }` to prevent unnecessary recompositions
 - **Content Type**: Added `contentType = { "event_card" }` to help LazyColumn optimize item recycling
 - **Memoized Click Handler**: Used `remember` to prevent recreating the click handler on every recomposition

3. **EventCard Component Optimizations**
 - Removed unstable `Context` parameter from EventCard
 - Simplified the component structure to reduce recomposition triggers
 - Used callback pattern for click handling instead of passing context

4. **Data Flow Improvements**
 - Pre-converted scraped data to stable data classes
 - Maintained backward compatibility with existing JSON serialization
 - Reduced runtime map access operations

### **Technical Details:**

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
// Optimized data class with stable keys
data class DreamParkEvent(
 val title: String,
 val date: String,
 val link: String
) {
 val key: String by lazy { "${title.hashCode()}_${date.hashCode()}" }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
// Optimized LazyColumn with stable keys and content types
LazyColumn(...) {
 items(
 items = dreamParkEvents,
 key = { event -> event.key },
 contentType = { "event_card" }
 ) { dreamParkEvent ->
 EventCard(
 event = dreamParkEvent,
 onEventClick = onEventClick
 )
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **Expected Performance Benefits:**

- **Reduced Recompositions**: Stable keys prevent unnecessary item recompositions during scrolling
- **Better Memory Management**: Content types help LazyColumn recycle views more efficiently
- **Faster Data Access**: Direct property access instead of map lookups
- **Smoother Scrolling**: Eliminated unstable parameters that caused UI stuttering

### **Testing Recommendation:**

I recommend testing the app on a mobile device to verify the scrolling performance improvements. The optimizations should result in:
- Smoother scrolling with less frame drops
- Faster initial rendering of the list
- Better responsiveness during rapid scrolling

The changes maintain full backward compatibility with your existing data storage and web scraping functionality while significantly improving the UI performance.

 - Eliminated map access overhead in the UI layer

2. **LazyColumn Optimizations**
 - **Stable Keys**: Added `key = { event -> event.key }` to prevent unnecessary recompositions
 - **Content Type**: Added `contentType = { "event_card" }` to help LazyColumn optimize item recycling
 - **Memoized Click Handler**: Used `remember` to prevent recreating the click handler on every recomposition

3. **EventCard Component Optimizations**
 - Removed unstable `Context` parameter from EventCard
 - Simplified the component structure to reduce recomposition triggers
 - Used callback pattern for click handling instead of passing context

4. **Data Flow Improvements**

 - Maintained backward compatibility with existing JSON serialization

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/ui/ListViewScreen.kt mode=EXCERPT

 val title: String,
 val date: String,

}

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/example/jetpackcomposefirstproject/ui/ListViewScreen.kt mode=EXCERPT

- **Better Memory Management**: Content types help LazyColumn recycle views more efficiently

 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {
 148	 var left = startFrom
 149	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 150	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 151	
 152	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 153	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 154	
 155	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 156	
 157	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 158	 while (true) {
 159	 try {
 160	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 161	
 162	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 163	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 164	 upperBoundRequests++
 165	
 166	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 167	
 168	
 169	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 170	 lastValidPage = right
 171	 left = right
 172	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 173	 } else {
 174	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 175	
 176	 break
 177	 }
 178	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 179	
 180	 break
 181	 }
 182	 }
 183	 } else {
 184	
 185	 }
 186	
 187	
 188	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 189	
 190	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 191	 while (left <= right) {
 192	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 193	
 194	 try {
 195	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 196	
 197	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 198	
 199	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 200	 } else {
 201	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 202	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 203	 binarySearchRequests++
 204	
 205	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 206	 content
 207	 }
 208	
 209	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 210	 lastValidPage = mid
 211	 left = mid + 1
 212	
 213	 } else {
 214	 right = mid - 1
 215	
 216	 }
 217	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 218	
 219	 right = mid - 1
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	
 223	
 224	
 225	 return lastValidPage
 226	}

 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}

 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...

 69	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {

 73	 }

 75	}

 77	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 78	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data

 81	 }

 83

 88	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 89	
 90	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->

 92	 jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 96	 null
 97	 }
 98	 }
 99	}

 119	 fun forceRefresh() {
 120	 refreshTrigger++

 123	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 124	 isLoading = true

 127	 try {

 131	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean

 134	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 135	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 136	
 137	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 138	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 139	 needsFreshScrape = true
 140	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 141	 needsFreshScrape = true
 142	 } else {
 143	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 144	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 145	 }
 146	
 147	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 148	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 149	
 150	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 151	 try {
 152	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 153	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 154	
 155	 val scrapedEvents: List<Map<String, String>> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 156	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 157	 }
 158	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 159	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 160	
 161	 dreamParkEvents = scrapedEvents
 162	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 163	
 164	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 165	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 166	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 167	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 168	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 169	 }
 170	
 171	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 172	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 173	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(scrapedEvents)
 174	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime

 176	
 177	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 178	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 179	 }
 180	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 181	 }
 182	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 183	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 184	
 185	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 186	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 187	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 188	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 189	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 190	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 191	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 192	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 193	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 194	 loadedFromCache = true
 195	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 196	 } else {
 197	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 198	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 199	 }
 200	 }
 201	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null

 206	 }

 215	 } else {

 217	 }

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 51	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 78	
 79	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 80	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 81	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 82	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 83	
 84	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 85	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 86	
 87	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 88	 } else {
 89	 cachedLastPage
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 93	
 94	 actualLastPage
 95	 } else {
 96	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 97	
 98	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 99	 }
 100	 } else {
 101	
 102	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 106	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 107	
 108	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 109	
 110	
 111	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 112	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 113	 val semaphore =
 114	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }

 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {
 148	 var left = startFrom
 149	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 150	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 151	
 152	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 153	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 154	
 155	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 156	
 157	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 158	 while (true) {
 159	 try {
 160	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 161	
 162	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 163	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 164	 upperBoundRequests++
 165	
 166	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 167	
 168	
 169	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 170	 lastValidPage = right
 171	 left = right
 172	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 173	 } else {
 174	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 175	
 176	 break
 177	 }
 178	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 179	
 180	 break
 181	 }
 182	 }
 183	 } else {
 184	
 185	 }
 186	
 187	
 188	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 189	
 190	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 191	 while (left <= right) {
 192	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 193	
 194	 try {
 195	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 196	
 197	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 198	
 199	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 200	 } else {
 201	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 202	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 203	 binarySearchRequests++
 204	
 205	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 206	 content
 207	 }
 208	
 209	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 210	 lastValidPage = mid
 211	 left = mid + 1
 212	
 213	 } else {
 214	 right = mid - 1
 215	
 216	 }
 217	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 218	
 219	 right = mid - 1
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	
 223	
 224	
 225	 return lastValidPage
 226	}

 264	// Helper function to fetch page content
 265	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 266	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 267	 return response.bodyAsText()
 268	}
 269	
 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}
 284	
 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 51	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
...
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }

 216	 }

 218	
 219	 right = mid - 1
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	
 223	
 224	
 225	 return lastValidPage

 228	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 229	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 230	 client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int, cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 231	): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 232	 return try {
 233	 val pageStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 234	
 235	
 236	 val fetchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 237	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 238	 // Use cached response from binary search
 239	
 240	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 241	 } else {
 242	 // Fetch page if not cached
 243	
 244	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 245	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 246	
 247	 content
 248	 }

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 51	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {

 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 78	
 79	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 80	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 81	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 82	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 83	
 84	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 85	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 86	
 87	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 88	 } else {
 89	 cachedLastPage
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 93	
 94	 actualLastPage
 95	 } else {
 96	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 97	
 98	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 99	 }
 100	 } else {
 101	
 102	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 106	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 107	
 108	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 109	
 110	
 111	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 112	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 113	 val semaphore =
 114	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }
