 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {
 148	 var left = startFrom
 149	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 150	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 151	
 152	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 153	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 154	
 155	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 156	
 157	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 158	 while (true) {
 159	 try {
 160	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 161	
 162	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 163	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 164	 upperBoundRequests++
 165	
 166	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 167	
 168	
 169	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 170	 lastValidPage = right
 171	 left = right
 172	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 173	 } else {
 174	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 175	
 176	 break
 177	 }
 178	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 179	
 180	 break
 181	 }
 182	 }
 183	 } else {
 184	
 185	 }
 186	
 187	
 188	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 189	
 190	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 191	 while (left <= right) {
 192	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 193	
 194	 try {
 195	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 196	
 197	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 198	
 199	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 200	 } else {
 201	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 202	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 203	 binarySearchRequests++
 204	
 205	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 206	 content
 207	 }
 208	
 209	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 210	 lastValidPage = mid
 211	 left = mid + 1
 212	
 213	 } else {
 214	 right = mid - 1
 215	
 216	 }
 217	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 218	
 219	 right = mid - 1
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	
 223	
 224	
 225	 return lastValidPage
 226	}

 228	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 229	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 230	 client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int, cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 231	): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 232	 return try {
 233	 val pageStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 234	
 235	
 236	 val fetchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 237	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 238	 // Use cached response from binary search
 239	
 240	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 241	 } else {
 242	 // Fetch page if not cached
 243	
 244	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 245	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 246	
 247	 content
 248	 }
 249	
 250	 val parseStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 251	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 252	 System.currentTimeMillis() - parseStartTime
 253	 System.currentTimeMillis() - pageStartTime
 254	
 255	
 256	 pageEvents
 257	
 258	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 259	
 260	 null
 261	 }
 262	}

 264	// Helper function to fetch page content
 265	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 266	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 267	 return response.bodyAsText()
 268	}
 269	
 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}
 284	
 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...
